title.narrative: FATA Temporarily Displaced Persons Emergency Recovery Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) Temporarily Displaced Persons (TDPs) Emergency Recovery Project for Pakistan is to support the early recovery of families affected by the militancy crisis, promote child health, and strengthen emergency response safety net delivery systems in the affected areas of FATA. The project comprises of three components. The first component, early recovery package for temporary displaced persons will aim to support the early recovery of approximately 120,000 TDP families from FATA through two unconditional cash grants: (i) a one-time early recovery grant (ERG) of United States (U.S.) $350 per family and; (ii) a livelihood support grant (LSG) of U.S. $160 per family in four monthly installments of U.S. $40. The second component, promoting child health in selected areas of FATA will be available to all families with children aged 0-2 years, belonging to the targeted agencies of FATA irrespective of whether they are TDPs. The third component, strengthening program management and oversight will provide technical assistance to enhance program management, transparency, and accountability at the federal, FATA secretariat, and local level administration through capacity building, stakeholder consultation, social mobilization and awareness, strategic communication, and monitoring.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Implementation Units I | Description :EAD to establish and maintain a PMU within EAD, responsible for thecarrying out of the technical coordination and day-to-day implementation of Component 1 and 2 of the Project. | Due Date:31-Aug-2015

Finance Agreement :Implementation Units II | Description :EAD to establish and maintain a Steering Committee and a Review Committeeto: (i) provide overall operational and decision making support, and (ii) implementation support and interagency coordination,respectively. | Due Date :30-Sep-2015
Finance Agreement :Project Operational Manual | Description :EAD/NADRA to carry out the Project in accordance with the ProjectOperations Manual. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Agreement | Description :EAD, NADRA and Merged Areas Secretariat to enter into an ImplementationAgreement setting forth their respective powers, functions duties and responsibilities revising the existing implementationcontracts Due Date :30-September-2019

Finance Agreement :Agency Agreement | Description :EAD, NADRA, Merged Areas Secretariat and payment agents (financial institutions) to enter into an agency agreement, revising the existing agency contracts | Due Date :30-September-2019

Finance Agreement :Annual Work Plan | Description :EAD to ensure sufficient appropriation and availability of resources to financeCash Gant to all Eligible TDPs willing to participate in the repatriation program, prepare annual work plans detailing activitiesand resources, and ensure timely allocation of resources and implementation thereof | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Environmental and Social Management Plan | Description :EAD and NADRA to carry out the Project, and cause theDOH (FATA Secretariat) to carry out, the activities under the Project in accordance with the ESMP. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Grievance Redress Mechanism | Description :EAD and NADRA to establish and maintain a grievance redress mechanismwith reception counters in each OSS/CFC in order to address complaints filed by Eligible Beneficiaries or residents of tribaldistricts in KP. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Operational Review firm hired | Description :NADRA to contract the service of consultancy firm to carry outoperational reviews of the Project and provide regular feedback and share its findings with EAD's Review Committee. | Due Date:30-Nov-2015

Finance Agreement :Engagement and Outreach Campaign | Description :NADRA to develop and implement a beneficiary engagement andoutreach campaign for Component 1 and 2, in coordination with the FATA Secretariat/DoH. | Due Date :30-Nov-2015
Finance Agreement :One Stop Shops (OSS)/Citizen Facilitation Centers (CFC) | Description :NADRA to establish and maintain OSS/CFCin the tribal districts of KP. | Due Date :31-August-2019

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section 1, B, 2(b) | Description :The Recipient shall ensure that each OSS/CFC is adequately staffedwith professional staff possessing necessary experience and qualifications acceptable to the Association and operating under termsof reference agreed to between the Recipient and the Association. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
EAD and NADRA to adopt a revised Project Operations Manual approved by the Association which covers agreed operations to beincluded under CFC. | Due Date :31-August-2019
Furnish to the Bank for approval by April 30 of each year, the annual work plan and budget for all components of the project.
